fields.summary: No ability to enable logging for Eucalyptus DNS

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description: We're debug-logging all DNS queries and that will result in too many log messages. See DnsResolvers.java:510.
fields.summary: Do not log dns resolver message

comments.body: Why remove this?  This is helpful for debugging right?  Doesn't this help with triaging?
[~hspencer], agreed.  Leave in at DEBUG level please
I think we are not logging the DNS query, we are logging some not very useful information at debug on each request and this should be fixed.
[~sjones], thanks.  Re-opening and assigned back to Sang-Min

I am reopening this issue because in 4.0.1, any DNS queries are not logged.  

# Set Cloud Logging to DEBUG
{code}
euca-modify-property -p cloud.euca_log_level=DEBUG
{code}
# Run a tail of all the cloud logs under /var/log/eucalyptus on the CLC:
{code}
tail -f /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-*.log | grep -i resolv | grep -i dns
{code}
# Query against the Eucalyptus DNS server running on the CLC:
{code}
$ nslookup 10.104.7.12 10.104.10.55
Server:		10.104.10.55
Address:	10.104.10.55#53

12.7.104.10.in-addr.arpa	name = euca-10-104-7-12.future.future.euca-hasp.cs.prc.eucalyptus-systems.com.
{code}
# No log messages seen on the CLC regarding DNS returning information about the lookup:
{code}
[root@odc-f-13 ~]# tail -f /var/log/eucalyptus/cloud-*.log | grep -i resolv | grep -i dns

This is a HUGE issue, and should be fixed ASAP.  The only way to get any helpful information is by using tools like tcpdump or ngrep to see information on the wire.

[~tjcramer],[~kedwards], can we get this resolved ASAP for 4.0.2?
[~hspencer] This bug was only about some cryptic message that is not related to the query. Please open another ticket if you find a bug.

On a related note, I'm not sure if writing logs for every dns query is a good idea. Typically it takes milliseconds for a process to write a file, while the latency for a dns query is also milliseconds level. We may need a configurable property to control this behavior.

[~hspencer]
The one line that was fixed for this ticket is this:
LOG.debug( "DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolvers for " + name + " are: " + resolverList );

The log line removed was something like:
"DnsResolvers.findRecords(): resolves for google.com are RecursiveDnsResolver"
